item.title: That's the questions. Now, you the OSM community can decide. The OSM Community forum is a great way to discuss these important topics https://community.openstreetmap.org/c/osmf/41

Q14 ‚ÄúThe Overture Maps Foundation has been a topic of discussion within the OSM community. What is your position on this initiative and how does it impact the project?‚Äú https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q14_Perspective_on_Overture_Maps

Q13 ‚ÄúIn the leadup to the election, the OSMF encountered issues with its open-source membership management system, CivicCRM. This reignited a long-running debate about whether the OSMF should consider using non-open-source third-party software to address such challenges. Is it acceptable for the OSMF to use non-free software if it supports OSM's goals?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q13_Perspective_on_Open_Source

Q12 ‚ÄúIn light of recent vandalism incidents, what if anything should the Board do differently in the area of data protection and quality assurance?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q12_Data_Quality_and_Protection

Q11 ‚ÄúOpenStreetMap relies heavily on technology. How satisfied are you with the current state of the technology that powers OSM? How would you support or encourage technological advancements and innovation within the OSM ecosystem? What technology changes are the most pressing?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q11_Technology_and_Innovation

Q10 ‚ÄúHow would you promote diverse voices and perspectives from the global OpenStreetMap community? What steps would you take to attract and retain high-quality volunteers and contributors, especially in underrepresented groups and locations? How would you ensure the OSMF is a safe and welcoming place for all contributors?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q10_Promoting_Community_and_Attracting_Volunteers

Q09 ‚ÄúThe OSMF's primary mission is supporting the global OpenStreetMap community. What specific contributions have you made to OpenStreetMap that reflect your commitment to this mission? Have you participated in cooperative mapping, tagging development, OSM-related software or map style development, or spoken at events or conferences? Have you engaged with the OSM community in your local area or in languages other than English?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q09_Your_Community_Contributions

Q08 ‚ÄúIn 2023, the SotM conference was not held. In 2024, the conference was held, however, some community members expressed concern about safety for participants from marginalized groups and pointed to the OSMF's SotM participant safety policy. How should the OSMF ensure that SotM is held annually, while also being safe and accessible for all members of the global community?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q08_State_of_the_Map

Q07 ‚ÄúThe OSMF sometimes receives legal threats or faces political pressure due to controversial topics or disputed territories in the map data. How would you deal with these situations? Are you prepared for potential travel restrictions or government pressure because of the nature of OpenStreetMap data?‚Äú https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q07_Handling_Legal_and_Political_Challenges

Q06 ‚ÄúHow important do you think fundraising is for the OSMF, and what experience do you have in this area? Have you participated in direct fundraising, grant writing, or public speaking to raise funds?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q06_Fundraising_and_Resource_Development

Q05 ‚ÄúHow do you plan to collaborate with other Board members and Working Groups to make decisions and resolve conflicts? Have you been in touch with current Board members to understand the challenges and responsibilities of the role? Which Working Groups would you like to collaborate with, and which Board Officer role or Committee Chair position interests you most, and why?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q05_Decision-Making_and_Collaboration

Q04 ‚ÄúWhat are your thoughts on the OSMF‚Äôs strategic plan, and what changes would you suggest to ensure OpenStreetMap‚Äôs long-term sustainability? If elected, what would be your top priority? Do you think the OSMF should proceed with the planned relocation outside the UK?‚Äú https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q04_Strategic_Vision_and_Sustainability

Q03 ‚ÄúHow would you ensure that the Board‚Äôs decisions and actions are transparent and accountable to the OSM community?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q03_Transparency_and_Accountability

Q02 ‚ÄúDo you currently have any conflicts of interest that might affect your role on the Board? If so, what are they and how would you manage them? Can you share examples of how you have handled conflicts of interest in the past?‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q02_Conflict_of_Interest_Management

Q01: ‚ÄúWhy do you want to join the OSMF Board, and what do you hope to accomplish as a board member over the next two years‚Äù https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Q01_Motivation_and_Objectives

The #OpenStreetMap Foundation Board election in Oct will chose 4 new board members. As well as their manifestos, the 10 candidates have answers these 14 questions from the OSM community. Be informed! üß† Vote! üó≥ It's your Foundation! Read their answers here: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos #OpenStreetMap #OSM #OSMF #OSMFAGM

10 Candidates are competing for 4 seats on the OpenStreetMap Foundation Board, to be elected in Oct. üó≥Ô∏è All the candidates' manifesto have now been published and available for you! The OSMF belongs to you, the members. üôÇ Read the candidates manifestos and inform yourself! ü§ì https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2024/Election_to_Board/Answers_and_manifestos/Manifestos #OpenStreetMap #OSM #OSMF #OSMFoundation #OSMFAGM2024

OpenStreetMap data powers The Washington Post's story about the size and territory of supermarket chains in USA. OSM is more than a map, we're a database. Everyone (incl you!) gets the same full access to the data, for free. And if it's incorrect, you can fix it immediately. We love to see new and surprising uses of OSM data like this. What will you create with OpenStreetMap? https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2024/grocery-store-owners-map-kroger-albertsons-merger/ #OpenStreetMap #OSM

It's been 3 weeks since #StateoftheMap2024. Check out the official memories thread, share your memories, or check out what you missed! (and give the excellent hard working volunteers on the State of the Map WG (@sotm) a follow. üôÇ ) https://en.osm.town/@sotm/113189293849394736 #OpenStreetMap #OSM #gischat #maps

OpenStreetMap.org website & our mapping API will be read-only for server maintenance for 1 hour on 26 September 2024. Please see the announcement from the OSM Ops team: https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/openstreetmap-maintenance-26-september-2024/118989 Or follow them on @osm_tech: https://en.osm.town/@osm_tech/113166418397142188 #OpenStreetMap #OSM
